title: Jaycoinz
author: Jaycoinz
content: Has anyone ever thought of investing in Bitcoin in previous years, but later left out due to negative though that Bitcoin will not have positive value in time to come.    Let share our experience.   As for me I still regret my actions years back, but I still believe that it's never too late.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: My regret is not getting very curious to know more about Bitcoin in the earlier years when I heard people talk about it and when I saw the price, i thought it was already too expensive for me However since I got to know and use Bitcoin, no negative remarks have ever made me stop believing in Bitcoin. All i try to do is challenge myself to hold Bitcoins long enough. Even the earlier adopters who had 500 BTC and did not hold long enough didn't really enough the benefits of the price pump after some years.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Pretty much majority of people? They'll buy at near peak when hype is rampant, then panic sell when the bubble bursts thinking bitcoin is dead.As for me — once I've learned enough about bitcoin 7 years ago, I remained longterm bullish. What needed fixing on my side was only my allocations as I was almost always over invested; leaving me with very little dry powder when crashes came.

comments.author: Marvell1
comments.body: Quote from: Jaycoinz on March 07, 2023, 09:40:45 AMHas anyone ever thought of investing in Bitcoin in previous years, but later left out due to negative though that Bitcoin will not have positive value in time to come.    Let share our experience.   As for me I still regret my actions years back, but I still believe that it's never too late. Many people have missed an opportunity like you, myself included, but I never regret it because I know that no matter what I do, time will not come back for us to fix it. Instead, I will try to look to the future and will never let those mistakes happen again. The opportunity to invest in bitcoin is still there and always will be, it's never too late, and those who grab it now will have the same opportunity as early bitcoin adopters. We are still in the early stages of the bitcoin revolution.

comments.author: bettercrypto
comments.body: Quote from: Jaycoinz on March 07, 2023, 09:40:45 AMHas anyone ever thought of investing in Bitcoin in previous years, but later left out due to negative though that Bitcoin will not have positive value in time to come.    Let share our experience.   As for me I still regret my actions years back, but I still believe that it's never too late. During the last two bull runs that happened, I was blaming myself for why I didn't find a way to buy bitcoin when its value was still low in the market.     Especially during the times when I reached a drop of 180$ for each bitcoin, considering that during those times I was not that deep in having an interest in bitcoin. That's why if the past can really be brought back but it's not possible anymore and we have to accept and prepare for the future that's what's important.So this is what I'm doing now that I didn't do when the two bull seasons passed because I don't want to be late anymore.

comments.author: sulendra12
comments.body: Quote from: Jaycoinz on March 07, 2023, 09:40:45 AMHas anyone ever thought of investing in Bitcoin in previous years, but later left out due to negative though that Bitcoin will not have positive value in time to come. At the time when I was at high school, I though the price was really expensive back then(it's still expensive today) and I thought to myself "I don't think this is legit because I had never heard of this one before and this was a scam when I did PTC back then) so I refrain myself from investing in Bitcoin because lack of money and didn't make me interested to invest but at least I did still jump to Bitcoin train in 2016 and still got pretty much good profit until today, so there is no such thing as late in cryptocurrency.

comments.author: Flexystar
comments.body: Like many times man. I was one of that person who knew bitcoin since the beginning but had zero courage to trust it in the first glance and invest money into it. When my circle started trading bitcoin I was really left out of the circle and was not much interested in it. However, few of my friends really helped me to get involved with the bitcoin in long terms. Initially when I heard about bitcoin, I was just reading about it and seeing the blogs over internet. It was until 2015-16 when I started with first purchase through local bitcoins and made ownership with it. There were still regrets because I sold almost all of them in just 6-7 months after booking some profits. Then in 2017 I regretted the most of my life right there since bitcoin had that magical pump and I could have been half millionaire already. I think there are almost everyone who has gone through such drama.

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: Quote from: Jaycoinz on March 07, 2023, 09:40:45 AM   As for me I still regret my actions years back, but I still believe that it's never too late. Do you know that you that have just decided to invest in bitcoins can in no time have more bitcoins than someone who has been into bitcoins for a longer time than you have? Sometimes it is not not just how long you have known and owned some bitcoins, what matters more is how much bitcoin you have been able to keep. Develop good habit and a consistent behavior/pattern to buying and keeping bitcoins, be dedicated to it since you already know that you have lost some time already. Bitcoin Halving is expected to happen soon, you will be happy tomorrow if you develop the habit of buying and keeping the bitcoins till halving occurs.

comments.author: Tellek Garing
comments.body: Quote from: Jaycoinz on March 07, 2023, 09:40:45 AMHas anyone ever thought of investing in Bitcoin in previous years, but later left out due to negative though that Bitcoin will not have positive value in time to come.    Let share our experience.   As for me I still regret my actions years back, but I still believe that it's never too late.  In 2011, I was freelancing with my old laptop when a client proposed to pay me in Bitcoin. However, due to my apprehension about the lack of monetary value at that time, I declined the payment. Reflecting back on that experience, I regret not accepting the offer, as I could have potentially become a millionaire today had I accepted the quantity of Bitcoin that the client was offering to pay me.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: Jaycoinz on March 07, 2023, 09:40:45 AMHas anyone ever thought of investing in Bitcoin in previous years, but later left out due to negative though that Bitcoin will not have positive value in time to come.    Let share our experience.   As for me I still regret my actions years back, but I still believe that it's never too late. In as much as you believe its never too late, I still think that some opportunities never come to us again when we miss it.For me personally, I discovered bitcoin in late 2015, Bitcoin was still pretty cheap back then, I could have bought a lot of it but didn't, and my not buying is not because I thought Bitcoin's value would never increase, No, but rather, I was because, at that time, I was so poor, i barely get enough money to feed and take care of my self and my family properly, let alone having extra to invest in bitcoin, this is one of the reasons why i don't really regret missing out big on bitcoin, because there was nothing I could have done. But then, I am still thankful because, even though I didn't invest in bitcoin in its early stage, my financial life have turned around for better through the same bitcoin, i now have a good business and several ways i earn extra income through the same bitcoin, I don't have much regrets.

comments.author: carlfebz2
comments.body: Quote from: Jaycoinz on March 07, 2023, 09:40:45 AMHas anyone ever thought of investing in Bitcoin in previous years, but later left out due to negative though that Bitcoin will not have positive value in time to come.    Let share our experience.   As for me I still regret my actions years back, but I still believe that it's never too late. My regrets are this.1. Didnt save up Bitcoin for moonbag, wayback im earning bitcoin but i do cash it out or converted to fiat immediately after i had recieved it.2. Lost up lots of Bitcoin wayback when Hyip/Ponzi scheme sites are flooding in the marketTrying to remember or on the time that i have seen or realized this, then it  cant really be avoided for you not to regret out because if you have done the opposite then i might be rich now.

comments.author: cydrix
comments.body: Quote from: Jaycoinz on March 07, 2023, 09:40:45 AMAs for me I still regret my actions years back, but I still believe that it's never too late. If you are talking about regrets then let me join. Way back 2017 when I first heard bitcoin I did not really believe in it since I was not old enough but I realized that starting young is not a bad idea. I should have believe in it and invested bigger since I have a money to spare that time and the price was cheaper than right now. I am not gonna miss this time and 100% believe that I'm not gonna regret it. I'll be saving up bitcoin and not gonna spend it like before.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: Quote from: Jaycoinz on March 07, 2023, 09:40:45 AMHas anyone ever thought of investing in Bitcoin in previous years, but later left out due to negative though that Bitcoin will not have positive value in time to come.    Let share our experience.   As for me I still regret my actions years back, but I still believe that it's never too late. For the past years when Bitcoin have no influence on the society, many people do have a shambles thought of Bitcoin, and especially investing for long term duration, sometimes we won't blame them because they are ignorant of Bitcoin investment, past five years many people doesn't believe or have trust on Bitcoin, Bitcoin investment is something of determination and that's while so many of us who has invested in Bitcoin will continue to advice a beginner not to use all it has for prolong Bitcoin investment, what a good investors uses for cryptocurrency investment and especially bitcoin is a spare money because of it's disadvantage of market.

comments.author: |MINER|
comments.body: Quote from: Jaycoinz on March 07, 2023, 09:40:45 AMSnipIn the case of trading, there is no benefit in feeling regret about the previous trading and there is no need to feel regret because in every trading case these can never be successful trading. If you think about it like this, then after every trading, everyone will have to feel regret, because this market is always moving, there will be ups and downs all the time.

comments.author: samcrypto
comments.body: Quote from: Jaycoinz on March 07, 2023, 09:40:45 AMHas anyone ever thought of investing in Bitcoin in previous years, but later left out due to negative though that Bitcoin will not have positive value in time to come.    Let share our experience.   As for me I still regret my actions years back, but I still believe that it's never too late. I didn’t regret to invest with Bitcoin even if its price is not rising simple because I believe in the future of Bitcoin. Though i regret for not starting right away since my friend already share his knowledge about Bitcoin and yet I failed to follow it that’s why I started here late and since then, I’m making sure that I will buy more bitcoin every time I see opportunity, and with this Bitcoin will be my safe haven in cryptomarket despite of its current trend.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: bettercrypto on March 07, 2023, 02:07:19 PMDuring the last two bull runs that happened, I was blaming myself for why I didn't find a way to buy bitcoin when its value was still low in the market.We tend to regret stuff like that on the hindsight, after seeing what we've missed. We feel satisfied opting out while the action is on until we look back and realize it was an opportunity that shouldn't have been missed. Now that we can take a guess at what the future portends, having learnt from history that every bull year has done better than the one before it, I want to believe you're positioning already for the next bull run that will likely happen in 2024/25? Don't miss this one for anything.

comments.author: palle11
comments.body: Quote from: Jaycoinz on March 07, 2023, 09:40:45 AM   Let share our experience.   As for me I still regret my actions years back, but I still believe that it's never too late. Just like you most of us have been outside while seeing and feeling we are missing opportunity and in actual fact we lack the courage to go in to it. I have seen some traders not able to hodl their coins for long because of volatility. The season is yet approaching and I hope I can hodl some fraction in expectation for the bull run after halving.

comments.author: goaldigger
comments.body: You are not alone, many have this experience as well of not buying early despite of their knowledge with Bitcoin and personally I regret this before but since I can’t do anything about it anymore I just move on and make sure to buy more especially now that I know the importance of Bitcoin. You can always buy Bitcoin because its not always pumping, just continue to analyze when to buy so when you see opportunity, grab it. Bull season is still far from reality, use this time to accumulate slowly but surely.

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: I am sure you will find many such users on this forum but the truth is that they all invested or earned bitcoin from one time and are continuing to do so over the years. The reason why they did not invest must have been outweighed by the price rise and thus the profitability. This I don't blame them because we all like to keep our hard earned money safe and this the caution. But it is never late to start again. One can buy Bitcoin in this market too and hope for better returns.

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: Quote from: Jaycoinz on March 07, 2023, 09:40:45 AMHas anyone ever thought of investing in Bitcoin in previous years, but later left out due to negative though that Bitcoin will not have positive value in time to come.    Let share our experience.   As for me I still regret my actions years back, but I still believe that it's never too late. You're not alone.All of us have that kind of regret that we knew bitcoin years ago and then we did nothing because all of our actions were limited, we're younger during those times and we're not too financially free.But right now, years has passed and for sure most lives have improved and everyone now can start investing to bitcoin from their salaries or any other source of income that they've worked for.
